description: From Latin haereticatus, past participle of haereticare.

verbs.description: hereticate (third-person singular simple present hereticates, present participle hereticating, simple past and past participle hereticated)

entries.meaning: (transitive) To denounce as heresy or a heretic.
examples: And let no one be minded, on the score of my neoterism, to hereticate me.
